come up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if someone comes up to you, they come close to you, especially in order to speak to you
come up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: One of the teachers came up and started talking to me.
A man came up to him and asked for a light.
come up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if someone comes up to a place, they travel north to the place where you are
come up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Why don’t you come up to New York for the weekend?
come up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a subject comes up, people mention it and discuss it
come up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: His name came up in the conversation.
The subject of salaries didn’t come up.
come up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a problem or difficulty comes up, it appears or starts to affect you
come up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our date – something’s come up.
The same problems come up every time.
come up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if a job or an opportunity comes up, it becomes available
come up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: A vacancy has come up in the accounts department.
come up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to be dealt with in a law court
come up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Your case comes up next week.
come up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to be going to happen soon
come up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: With Christmas coming up, few people have much money to spare.
come up.translation[0].definitions[7].de: if the sun or moon comes up, it moves up into the sky where you can see it
come up.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: It was six o'clock, and the sun was just coming up.
come up.translation[0].definitions[8].de: if a plant comes up, it begins to appear above the ground
come up.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: The first spring bulbs are just coming up.
come up.translation[0].definitions[9].de: if food comes up, it goes back through your mouth from your stomach after being swallowed
come up.translation[0].definitions[10].d: used to say that food or drink will be ready very soon
